law.catch_line: The governing body of St. Mary's County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section ...

section.section:
The governing body of St. Mary's County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against county property tax imposed on:
property that is:
owned by the St. George's Island Improvement Association, Incorporated; and
used only for community or civic purposes;
real property that is owned by the Seventh District Optimist Youth Foundation, Inc.;
real property, including any improvements, that is subject to a State or a county land preservation program; and
real property that:
was formerly used solely as a tobacco barn; and
is subject to a tobacco buyout agreement.

In authorizing a credit under paragraph (1)(iv) of this subsection, the governing body of the county may provide, by law, for:
the amount of the credit;
the duration of the credit; and
any other provision necessary to administer the credit.
The governing body of St. Mary's County may grant, by law, a property tax credit against the county property tax imposed on personal property.

A law adopted under paragraph (1) of this subsection may provide for:
the amount of a credit;
the subclasses of personal property under § 8-101(c) of this article to which the credit applies; and
other provisions necessary to administer the credit.

The governing body of St. Mary's County or of a municipal corporation in St. Mary's County may grant, by law, a property tax credit under this section against the county or municipal corporation property tax imposed on real property that is:
leased to a nonprofit school; and
used exclusively for primary or secondary educational purposes.
A property tax credit granted under this subsection shall continue as long as the property is in compliance with the terms of this subsection.
